ARABIC: قَالَتْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ إِنِّىٓ أُلْقِىَ إِلَىَّ كِتَٰبٌ كَرِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: She said, 'Council! a noble letter has been delivered to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (The Queen said): "O nobles, a venerable letter has been delivered to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The Queen said:" Know my nobles that a gracious letter has been delivered to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (The Queen of Sheba) said to her officials, "A gracious letter has been dropped before me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The woman said, “O chieftains, indeed a noble letter has been dropped upon me.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: She said: "O chiefs! Verily, here is delivered to me a noble letter, "
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: She said: O chief! surely an honorable letter has been delivered to me
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: She said, 'O Council, see, a letter honourable has been cast unto me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (The Queen of Sheba) said (when she received the letter): O chieftains! Lo! there hath been thrown unto me a noble letter.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The Queen of Sheba said, "O Counsellors, an honourable letter has been delivered to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: She said: O chiefs! verily there hath been cast unto me an honourable epistle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: She said, ‘O [members of the] elite! Indeed a noble letter has been delivered to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (The queen) said: "Ye chiefs! here is delivered to me - a letter worthy of respect.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: She said: "O chiefs! Verily! Here is delivered to me a noble letter,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: She (the Queen of Sheba) said: 'O Council, look, an honorable letter has been dropped to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: She said, “O Counselors, a gracious letter was delivered to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: She said, "O eminent ones, indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [27:29] Then, she said, to the noblemen of her people: ‘O [members of the] council, lo! (read yā ayyuhā’l-mala’u innī, pronouncing [in the last two words] both hamzas; or by not pronouncing the second one and changing it into a wāw with kasra vowelling) a noble, a sealed, letter has been delivered to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 428 He did as Solomon commanded, and Balqis took the letter and went to meet her entourage. ((The Queen of Sheba) said: chieftains! Lo! there hath been thrown unto me a noble letter) a sealed letter.
